title: @Reav3 After Yorick Rework
body:
So we all know that long awaited Yorick relunch is coming soon (patch 6.19-6.21 confirmed by Meddler) I'm super excited for him.
I was just wondering If Riot update team already know what champion they will work at after they finish Yorick. I was thinking about {{champion:80}} this dude is a Targon Aspect of War and sadly he looks like a basic spartan righ now. There is so much that can be done with him. Another champion is {{champion:6}} I just can't take him seriously cuz he looks so wierd. What are you guys planning next?

replies.body: {{champion:19}} is next on the list and iirc is supposed to be out early next year like Shen was this year. Sadly Urgots rework got shelved

Yep, Warwick's up next after Yorick. Reav3's also planning to do a general Champion Update post some moderately soon that I think will talk a bit about which champion we're thinking of for the slot after Warwick.

Meddler, has there been any talk about a rework for {{champion:17}} ?

While his kit is considered iconic, Teemo has really had difficulty fitting in team compositions especially in recent years and seems to be a mixed bag of being either a poor choice as a top laner or an off hand jungler (the latter of which seems more fitting to his kit). He's treated as a joke pick and has always been seen as unhealthy to the game as a result of his kit.

Other older yordle champs like Tristana, Heimer and Popppy received great updates; yet, Teemo has pretty much remained the same since day 1 aside from the mushroom toss/bounce mechanic and the slight updated to his passive last year and he's considered one of League's more recognizable champs as well. I'd appreciate a response if possible - thank you.

*sacrifices a virgin to the league gods*
Please let Morde at least be mentioned.

*sacrifices another one*
The character's got so much potential that he can't really live up to in this state :P

Urgot has to become pretty.
Otherwise, if we talk about small rework, i could see azir or aatrox to fit in it.
While instead mordekaiser and mundo for bigger reworks (after urgot obviously).
No way, he needs to remain a bad ass  tank.

I could easily be mistaken, but I seem to recall something about Urgot being difficult to rework due to his odd theme; ranged tank. i think{{champion:266}} deserves a rework right now, and maybe even {{champion:115}}
Aatrox should have one yeah. Ziggs is probably fine, but his Satchel being 26 seconds cd is so stupid.

If I had to throw three champs into the rework camp:

{{champion:266}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:54}} 

Aatrox is just a mess. Nothing else needed.

As a mastery 6 pantheon main, who thinks he's actually really bad top lane and better as a jungler, he's a one hit wonder that will always fall off late game. Last time I checked, artisans of war don't fall off. 
You harass with Q until you get cramps, W E and Q again if you didn't do enough damage. If you're ever reworking this champ, DO NOT CHANGE HIS ULT. IT IS TOO AWESOME. CHANGE HIS Q W E, SO WE ACTUALLY HAVE BETTER OPTIONS AND MORE COMBOS.

Malphite is terrible outside of his E and his Ultimate. AP malphite has no meaning to me when his kit revolves around stacking armor. He's one of the worst tanks in the game (opinion there) once you learn not to crowd in one spot during a teamfight, and build {{item:3035}} items. Even {{champion:33}} has more relevancy and he's one of the most predictable champs there is in what he builds, and playstyle. Q E W R over and over again. Malphite? Ult E W Q. Rinse repeat. Make him more dynamic. Why ever play malphite top when {{champion:154}} has more potential than he does, or {{champion:111}}.
